docs.snippet: Striking contrasts of the effect of the European war on the commerce of this port are revealed in the statistical review of exports and imports here last month, compared with July 1914, the month preceding the outbreak of hostilities abroad, made...
docs.lead_paragraph: Striking contrasts of the effect of the European war on the commerce of this port are revealed in the statistical review of exports and imports here last month, compared with July 1914, the month preceding the outbreak of hostilities abroad, made public yesterday by Acting Collector Stuart at the Custom House.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept 4. -- Conditions on the Mexican border are growing worse and there is concern here over the situation. It is apparent that a concerted movement exists to cause trouble in the American territory adjoining the international boundary...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept 4. -- Conditions on the Mexican border are growing worse and there is concern here over the situation. It is apparent that a concerted movement exists to cause trouble in the American territory adjoining the international boundary line. The greater part of the United States Army within continental United States is now engaged in border patrol duty.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 7. -- C. J. Maisch of New York, wireless operator in the Norwegian steamer Seattle and a nativeborn American citizen, who had been held in custody since the Seattle was captured near the Falkland Islands on March 14 last, has been...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 7. -- C. J. Maisch of New York, wireless operator in the Norwegian steamer Seattle and a nativeborn American citizen, who had been held in custody since the Seattle was captured near the Falkland Islands on March 14 last, has been released as the result of representations made in his behalf by the American Embassy.
docs.abstract: C. J. Maisch released by British, G. Vielmetter held, review of case

headline.main: BRITISH RELEASE AMERICAN.; Wireless Operator of Norwegian Ship Held Since March 14.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10. -- The Carranza reply to the recent peace proposal made by Secretary of State Lansing and the six ranking Latin-American diplomats in Washington will be delivered to Secretary Lansing tomorrow. This assurance was given to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10. -- The Carranza reply to the recent peace proposal made by Secretary of State Lansing and the six ranking Latin-American diplomats in Washington will be delivered to Secretary Lansing tomorrow. This assurance was given to officials of the State Department late this afternoon when they learned that the Carranza reply had been delivered to Special Agent John R. Silliman at Vera Cruz at noon today for transmission to Washington.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The reply of CARRANZA is just what it was expected to be. There is often a flamboyant quality in these Spanish-American state papers which tends to bewilder the sedate minds of Northerners, and translation of Spanish, and particularly of Mexican...
docs.lead_paragraph: The reply of CARRANZA is just what it was expected to be. There is often a flamboyant quality in these Spanish-American state papers which tends to bewilder the sedate minds of Northerners, and translation of Spanish, and particularly of Mexican Spanish, into English is a difficult task which is not always well performed; but we know that CARRANZA has rejected the friendly offices of the United States and the Latin-American republics.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12. -- Consideration probably will be given tomorrow by President Wilson and Secretary of State Lansing to the Mexican situation and the proposal made by General Venustiano Carranza that the Pan-American conferees meet with him in...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12. -- Consideration probably will be given tomorrow by President Wilson and Secretary of State Lansing to the Mexican situation and the proposal made by General Venustiano Carranza that the Pan-American conferees meet with him in some border city to discuss international questions growing out of the Mexican revolution.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15. -- Action that may have a far-reaching bearing on the Mexican situation is expected to be taken at the adjourned meeting of the Pan-American conference on Mexico, which is to be held in New York on Saturday. Robert Lansing, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15. -- Action that may have a far-reaching bearing on the Mexican situation is expected to be taken at the adjourned meeting of the Pan-American conference on Mexico, which is to be held in New York on Saturday. Robert Lansing, the Secretary of State, will preside over the meeting, and the other conferees will be the Ambassadors from Argentina, Brazil, and Chile, and the Ministers from Bolivia, Uruguay, and Guatemala.
docs.abstract: Consuls withdrawn from Villa territory and warning to U. S. citizens not to enter Mexico across northern boundary

headline.main: MOVES TO PREVENT REPRISALS BY VILLA; Consuls Recalled and Americans Warned as Conference Plans to Hear Carranza. TO MODIFY HIS PROPOSAL And Ask Him to Send Representatives to Washington ;- Villa Faction Enters Protest. MOVES TO PREVENT REPRISALS BY VILLA

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Some weeks ago the United States Government, through Secretary LANSING, and the Governments of Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Bolivia, Uruguay, and Guatemala, through their diplomatic representatives at Washington, invited FRANCISCO VILLA, leader of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Some weeks ago the United States Government, through Secretary LANSING, and the Governments of Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Bolivia, Uruguay, and Guatemala, through their diplomatic representatives at Washington, invited FRANCISCO VILLA, leader of the Conventionalists in Mexico, to join with the leaders of the other revolutionary factions in his country at a conference for the promotion of Mexican peace.
docs.abstract: Another Mexican muddle, (attitude of Pan-Amer. Conference toward Villa,)
